intro: Yucca aloifolia var. yucatana, commonly known as the Yucatan yucca, is a shrub-like plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula. It features tall, narrow, evergreen leaves that are often blue-gray in color, arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers on tall, branched inflorescences during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. This variety is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
